security_audit.summary: Documentation and validation skill with no code execution capabilities. The included Python validation script reads and validates command files using only Python standard library functions. The static scanner flagged 548 patterns in documentation markdown files as potential threats, but all are false positives - code examples in documentation were misinterpreted as executable code with vulnerabilities. The skill contains no network calls, no external command execution, no credential handling, and no data exfiltration capabilities.

content.user_title: Create slash commands for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Users need a way to create standardized, validated slash commands for their Claude Code workflows. This skill provides expert guidance on command structure, YAML schema, argument handling, and security best practices.
actual_capabilities: Creates Claude Code slash commands with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown body
Validates command schema including naming conventions, field formats, and tool permissions
Provides templates and patterns for common command types (git, testing, scaffolding)
Documents security considerations including input validation and path sanitization
Offers guidance on argument handling with $1, $2, and $ARGUMENTS variables
Includes a validation script to verify commands meet quality standards
limitations: Does not execute the slash commands it creates - only provides documentation and validation
Requires Claude Code environment to use the generated commands
Security validation is advisory - does not prevent unsafe commands from being written

prompt_templates.title: Security hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my command that uses Bash tool and suggest security improvements.

output_examples.input: Create a slash command called create-component that generates React components
output: Allowed tools: Read, Write, Grep, Glob

best_practices: Use version aliases like claude-haiku-4-5 for model field - short aliases cause API errors in commands
Start with minimal tool permissions and only add Write, Edit, or Bash when truly necessary
Document all arguments with argument-hint field and explain $1, $2, and $ARGUMENTS usage
anti_patterns: Using short model aliases (haiku, sonnet, opus) in commands - they cause model not found errors
Including both Write and Edit tools when the command only needs one file operation type
Using $ARGUMENTS directly in bash commands without validation - creates command injection risk

faq.question: What models work in slash commands?
faq.answer: Commands require version aliases like claude-haiku-4-5 or full IDs like claude-haiku-4-5-20251001. Short aliases only work in agents.

faq.question: What is the maximum command name length?
faq.answer: Command names must be 64 characters or less, using only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. Underscores are not allowed.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for project-level commands?
faq.answer: Yes. Commands can be created at project level, user level (~/.claude/commands/), or plugin level.

faq.question: Is the validation script safe to run?
faq.answer: Yes. The validation script only reads files and reports results. It does not modify files, execute commands, or access the network.

faq.question: Why does my command fail with model not found?
faq.answer: Commands require version aliases. Change model: haiku to model: claude-haiku-4-5 or remove the model field to inherit from conversation.

faq.question: How is this different from building agents?
faq.answer: Commands are user-triggered workflows with arguments. Agents are independent subagents. Use commands for discrete actions.
